detail.content: Fall 2011 Changes to Course Information | NYU School of Law                          Skip to main content                                     ›               Quicklinks       Areas of Study   Calendar   Career Services   Colloquia   Courses   Departments   Directories   Docket   Housing   Library   News and Press   NYU Home   Student Links   Technology                                              JD Admissions   Faculty & Scholarship   Global Opportunities   LLM/JSD Admissions   Academics & Courses   Law & Business   Executive Education   Current Students   Public Service   About NYU Law   Alumni & Giving   Centers & Institutes                               Home › Academics › Courses › Course Updates › Fall 2011 › Changes to Course Information                  Courses                 Fall 2011 Changes to Course Information                 Fall 2011       Announcements   Canceled Courses   Changes to Course Information   Classes Frozen Below Current Capacity   Faculty Profiles   New Course Offerings   New Section Offerings   Schedule Changes                            Academic Achievement Gaps: Law and Science Seminar (7/22/2011) A zero-credit writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule Administrative Process Seminar (6/9/2011) The course number for this seminar has been changed to LAW-LW.10470.001 . Schedule Administrative and Regulatory State for Transfer Students and LLMs (9/7/2011) The examination type for this course has been chnaged from a full-period take-home exam to an 8-hour fixed-scheduled take-home exam.  The exam is scheduled for Wednesday, December 21, 2011 . Schedule Antitrust Law and Economics Seminar: Writing Credit (9/2/2011) The correct credit allocation for this writing credit is 1 credit. Schedule Aristotle: Law, Politics and the Human Good Seminar (7/22/2011) A writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule Colloquium on Global and Comparative Public Law (7/22/2011) A writing credit has been added for this colloquium. Schedule Comparative Church State Relations: Old Regimes, New Challenges Seminar (7/22/2011) A writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule Comparative Constitutional Law & Politics Seminar (10/21/2011) A writing credit has been added for this semiinar. Schedule Constitutional Law (Sections 3 & 4) (8/30/2011) The 3L sections of this course (Sections 3 & 4) have been combined with the regular sections (1 & 2). Schedule Copyright Law (7/26/2011) This course is no longer mutually exclusive with Survey of Intellectual Property. Schedule Copyright Reform Seminar (7/22/2011) A writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule Corporate Finance (7/27/2011) The mid-term exam for this course is scheduled for October 24, 2011; the final exam is scheduled for Monday, December 19, 2011. Schedule Corporate Law Theory Seminar (7/22/2011) A writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule Corporate Governance (Stern Preferential Course) (6/23/2011) The correct course number for this preferential course is LAW-LW.11706.001. This is not a cross-listed course. Schedule Corporate Tax for ITP (9/2/2011) The date of the final exam for this course has been changed to Tuesday, December 15, 2011 . Schedule Corporations (Sections 5-8) (8/29/2011) Sections 5, 6, 7 and 8 of this course are restricted to LL.M. students.  ( All LL.M. students may now register for these sections.) Schedule Current Constitutional Issues Seminar and Writing Credit  (10/4/2011) A co-instructor has been added to this seminar. Schedule Developing Speaking Skills Through Legal English (Section 1) (6/24/2011) The professor assigned to this section has been changed. Schedule Duties of the Heart: Intention in Jewish Law Seminar (7/22/2011) A writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule Estate and Gift Taxation (7/14/2011) The exam date for this course has been changed to December 13, 2011. Schedule Evidence and Professional Responsibility (Section 2) (8/30/2011) The 3L section of this course (Section 2) has been combined with the regular section (1). Schedule Federal Courts and the Appellate Process (7/5/2011) Constitutional Law is a corequisite for this course; it is no longer a prerequisite. Schedule Free Speech (6/9/2011) The credit allocation for this course has been changed from 4 credits to 3 credits. Schedule Furman Scholars Seminar (6/8/2011) The credit allocation for this seminar has been changed from 1 credit to 0 credits. Schedule Government Civil Litigation Clinic - Eastern District (6/9/2011) The title of this clinic has been changed to Government Civil Litigation Clinic - Eastern District of New York . Schedule Government Civil Litigation Clinic - Southern District (6/9/2011) The title of this clinic has been changed to Government Civil Litigation Clinic - Southern District of New York . Schedule Hays Program Seminar (Section 1) (8/11/2011) The correct credit allocation for this section is 1 credit. Schedule Health Law Seminar (4/27/2011) The title of this seminar has been changed to Health Policy   Seminar. Schedule Health Policy Seminar (7/22/2011) A writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule How Washington Really Works (6/20/2011) The title of this seminar has been changed to Administrative Law in Practice Seminar . Schedule Human Trafficking Seminar (9/6/2011) A writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule Humanitarian Assistance after Armed Conflicts and Natural Disasters: Problems of Land and Property Rights Seminar (7/22/2011) A writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule Income Taxation of Trusts and Estates (Sections 1 and 2) (7/12/2011) The correct title of this course is Income Taxation of Trusts and Estates I. Schedule International Commercial Agreements in Practice Seminar (7/22/2011) A writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule International Criminal Law Seminar (7/22/2011) A writing credit has been added for this seminar. Schedule International Tax I and II (7/14/2011) The exam date for this course has been changed to December 20, 2011. Schedule Law and Business Projects Seminar (7/22/2011) The fall 2011 writing credit has been canceled.  Students should register for the spring 2012 writing credit for this seminar. Schedule Law and Development (11/04/2011) The one-hour in-class final exam for this course has been cancelled. Schedule Law of Democracy (8/23/2011) The title of this course has been changed to The Law of Democracy. Schedule LL.M. Honors Thesis Seminar (6/9/2011) The title of this seminar has been changed to LL.M. Honors Seminar . Schedule Mediation Clinic and Clinic Seminar (9/2/2011) An additional co-instructor has been added to this clinic and clinic seminar. Schedule Negotiating Mergers and Acquisitions (10/4/2011) The final exam for this course is scheduled for December 19, 2011 . Schedule Patent Law (7/26/2011) This course is no longer mutually exclusive with Survey of Intellectual Property. Schedule Patent Litigation Seminar and Writing Credit (11/18/2011) A co-instructor has been added to this seminar and writing credit. Schedule Professional Responsibility and the Regulation of Lawyers (Sections 3 & 4) (8/30/2011) The 3L sections of this course (Sections 3 & 4) have been combined with the regular sections (1 & 2). Schedule Prosecution Clinic - Eastern District of New York and Seminar (10/4/2011) The co-instructor for this clinic and clinic seminar has been changed. Schedule Quantitative Methods in Law II (7/22/2011) A zero-credit writing credit has been added for this course. Schedule Race and Legal Scholarship Seminar  (7/29/2011) This seminar is not mutually exclusive with the spring 2012 offering of Critical Race Theory Seminar. Schedule Readings in Legal Thought (6/9/2011) The credit allocation for this course has been changed from 2 credits to 1 credit. Schedule Sexuality and the Law Seminar  (8/31/2011) The first class meeting will be on Tuesday, September 13, 2011. Schedule Survey of Intellectual Property (7/26/2011) This course is no longer mutually exclusive with Patent Law, Copyright Law or Trademarks. Schedule Survey of Secutiries Regulation (10/11/2011) The exam for this course has been scheduled. Schedule Survey of Tax Procedure (Section 1) (7/14/2011) The exam for this course has been scheduled. Schedule Survey of Tax Procedure (Section 2) (9/16/2011) This is a seven-week course. The date of the final exam has been changed from December 21, 2011 to October 25, 2011 . Schedule Tax Deals (7/14/2011) The exam for this course has been scheduled. Schedule Tax Policy (7/14/2011) The exam for this course has been scheduled. Schedule Taxation of Subchapter S Corporations (7/14/2011) The exam date for this course has been changed to October 24, 2011. Jewish Law Students Association | NYU School of Law                          Skip to main content                                     ›               Quicklinks       Areas of Study   Calendar   Career Services   Colloquia   Courses   Departments   Directories   Docket   Housing   Library   News and Press   NYU Home   Student Links   Technology                                              JD Admissions   Faculty & Scholarship   Global Opportunities   LLM/JSD Admissions   Academics & Courses   Law & Business   Executive Education   Current Students   Public Service   About NYU Law   Alumni & Giving   Centers & Institutes                               Home › Student Organizations › Jewish Law Students Association             Jewish Law Students Association                 Jewish Law Students Association       Guide to Jewish Life/Resources   Contact Us                           The Jewish Law Students Association (JLSA) is designed to meet the needs of the Jewish student body within the NYU School of Law. Our organization includes secular as well as observant students, and all of our events are open to the entire law school community. Activities include social events, speakers on Jewish or legal topics, and events celebrating Jewish holidays. We are also affiliated with the University's Bronfman Center for Jewish Life and the Jewish Graduate Students Association.   Please check out the Resources link to see the "Jewish Law Students Association (JLSA): Guide to Jewish life in NYC" for listings of NYC restaurants, services, groceries and more!   If you have any questions or would like to get involved with events, please feel free to contact any member of the board under the Contact Us link.
